name: instigation
content:

the action of causing an event or situation to happen by making a set of actions or a formal process begin: at the instigation of The inquiry was begun at the instigation of a local MP. They were arrested on suspicion of the instigation of acts of terrorism. See
instigate
More examplesFewer examplesWe are carrying on with the search at the President's direct instigation.The unknown cause of death led to the instigation of a police investigation.She only took up photography at the instigation of her mother.
